BC Reference Model Version 1.0.0
cimi

Element ConditionTopic

Documentation:
Representation of a condition, independent of context of being present, absent, risk, expectation etc. 'Condition' is interpreted broadly to include disorder, abnormality, problem, injury, complaint, functionality, concern, illness, disease, ailment, sickness, affliction, upset, difficulty, disorder, symptom, etc. CIMI Alignment: In CIMI Version 0.0.4, this class was called ConditionAssertion, but CIMI has recently changed it to ConditionTopic. ConditionAssertion had properties associated with the presence of the condition, including severity, dueTo, diseasePhase, and more. In the current logical model, properties associated with condition occurrence have been moved to ConditionPresenceContext. The value set binding of Value is required to map to US-Core.
Ancestors:
  • Locatable

      • FindingTopic
        • AssertionTopic
          • ConditionTopic
Direct Descendants:
